page.title: 06ELECTRICITY
page.content: { Electricity}came to the island in {1970}_ by cable from Appin. Earlier lighting and cooking were by{Calor {Gas.}A few people had generators. Wiring in houses is therefore recent,and appliances recent too. Most houses have electric kettles, irons, cookers,{washing {machines,}refrigerators,{large chest {deep freezes,}television sets, immersion heaters. Some houses have tumble driers, music centres, deep friers, food mixers, slow cookers, liquidisers, micro-wave ovens. There are electric{pumps for water, electric lawn mowers, electric {machines for clipping sheep;}electric welders, drills, angle grinders; an electrically- powered lathe, planers and routers; electric sanders, jig-saws, battery chargers.......
